name: Dr. Amara Osei
core_wound: Grew up in Sector 8 (mid-level worker), escaped through education, feels guilt about leaving her community behind while benefiting from studying their suffering
wants: To understand why systems fail people, to publish groundbreaking research
needs: To realize research without action is complicity, to use her position to help not just observe
voice_markers: Academic language she tries to simplify
Asks questions instead of making statements
Apologizes unnecessarily when from lower-sector backgrounds
contradiction: Studies oppression while benefiting from it, wants to help but trained to be objective observer, cares deeply but hides behind professionalism
physical_description: Black woman, natural hair she straightens for professional settings then stops, dresses carefully in 'respectable' clothes, carries tablet everywhere, by trilogy's end looks less polished and more alive
skills: Understanding of both mid-tier and lower-tier cultures
flaws: Analysis paralysis - overthinks instead of acting
Fear of losing her hard-won status
knowledge_state_book1_start: Academic understanding of poverty and inequality
Theory but not practice of social change

relationships.Reed Salazar: Research subject becomes collaborator becomes something more, she learns to see him as person not data
relationships.Her academic department: Pressured by them to produce non-controversial results
relationships.Her family in Sector 8: Complicated - proud of her but she rarely visits
relationships.Corporate Board: Initially neutral, becomes enemy when her research threatens them
